CANW::
Uer the y
Set up research infrastructure | Reason: Need systematic tracking to prevent tunnel vision and lost work
JARVIS tracking it own development is very meta
Read "Generative Agents" paper
Set up GPT-2 baseline for multi-agent experiments
Define clear evaluation metrics for agent quality
Today I learned how to set up proper researchinfrastructure: git for code, JARVIS for thoughts, structured experiments
Start with debate experiments before emergent collaboration | Reason: Need solid baseline and infrastructure before exploring novelty
Week 1: Set up GPT-2 and baseline measurements
Week 2: Build and test two-agent debate system
Week 3: optimize debate and document findings
Week 4+: Design emergent collaboration experiments
Emergent collaboration could reveal natural coordination patterns
compare emergent vs structured on same tasks
Read Constitutional AI paper - learned how AI can critiqu itself to improve safety and quality
Read Generative Agents paper - saw how agents with memory and reflection create emergent behaviors
Constitutional AI's critique method could directly apply to our debate system
Generative Agents' memory architecture is similar to JARVIS - could use retrieval for agent context
Study both papers' methods for agent improvement | Reason: Directly relevant to debate and emergence experiments
Generative Agents' memory architecture maps perfectly to Phase 3 emergence research
Constitutional AI's critique method is exactly what debate phase needs
Implement memory retrieval before starting emergence phase | Reason: Generative Agents showed this is critical
Use COnstitutional AI prompting style for critic agent | Reason: Proven to work well
Implement recency + importance + relevance scoring for memory retrieval
Add reflection mechanism to agents (synthesize past experiences)
